thread.title: Marcos Rojo starts as United host Liverpool
thread.title_full: Marcos Rojo starts as United host Liverpool

author: Jack Sargeant
title: Marcos Rojo starts as United host Liverpool
text: Marcos Rojo starts as United host Liverpool Marcos Rojo returns to the centre of United’s defence against Liverpool. Rec Photo by Laurence Griffiths/Getty Images The teams are out for today’s encounter between Manchester United and Liverpool at Old Trafford. There are no surprises in the United lineup, though it’s good to see Marcos Rojo back after a short layoff. He partners Phil Jones in the centre of defence, with Chris Smalling made to settle for a place on the bench. Antonio Valencia and Matteo Darmian are the full-backs. Michael Carrick starts at the base of a midfield also containing Ander Herrera and Paul Pogba ; Anthony Martial and Henrikh Mkhitaryan are preferred to Marcus Rashford and Juan Mata either side of Zlatan Ibrahimović. All in all, it looks like United’s strongest possible lineup — let’s hope it shows on the field. — Manchester United (@ManUtd) January 15, 2017 Liverpool are without Joël Matip, while they await international clearance after the Cameroon international withdrew from his side’s AFCON squad. Meanwhile, a late injury to Nathaniel Clyne means another unfamiliar face comes into their defence with summer signing Ragnar Klavan : it's quite the occasion for teenage local lad Trent Alexander-Arnold to make his first ever Premier League start. #LFC team to face @ManUtd : Mignolet, Alexander-Arnold, Lovren, Klavan, Milner, Henderson, Can, Wijnaldum, Lallana, Firmino, Origi #MUNLIV — Liverpool FC (@LFC) January 15, 2017
